name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: These are challenging times for our residential facilities that serve North Dakota's most vulnerable youth. Today's executive order will allow for necessary changes to maintain critical operations in these facilities. Read more: http://www.governor.nd.gov/news/burgum-allows-changes-maintain-critical-services-vulnerable-youths-during-covid-19-pandemic …

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Join us for today’s COVID-19 press briefing at 3:30 p.m. CT. Watch live here: https://www.facebook.com/ndhealth/videos/2571516359803282/ …

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet:
Our positive case rate remains the 2nd-lowest in the nation at 3% (308 positive/10,350 total tests), and our per-capita testing rate ranks 9th among states. 

Together, we can continue to #SlowTheSpread and save lives. Be #NDSmart: stay home, stay healthy, stay connected. (4/4)

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We continue to fine-tune our hospital surge plan with our health care providers and partners. We're confident we will have the capacity we need should a surge of positive cases occur in ND. As of today less than 1% of our hospital beds are being used for COVID-19 patients. (3/4)

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We don’t expect to need these Tier 3 facilities at the Fargodome and University of Mary Fieldhouse in Bismarck, but it's our responsibility to protect the health & safety of our citizens and prepare for the worst-case scenario. (2/4)

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Working together, we've taken targeted action to slow the spread of COVID-19 in North Dakota so we can avoid having to use a Tier 3 minimum care facility like the Fargodome, where we have pre-positioned beds. (1/4) pic.twitter.com/p6Xbjif0Mz

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet:
North Dakotans are doing their part to slow the spread of COVID-19 and #FlattenTheCurve. These critical actions are helping us avoid pressure on our health care system and save lives.

Be #NDSmart: stay home, stay healthy, stay connected. pic.twitter.com/NoBbBawgS9

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Grateful to Dr. Anthony Fauci for sharing his time & expertise with us by phone this evening, and especially for affirming that ND is doing exactly what needs to be done to #SlowtheSpread of #COVID19. Appreciate his perspective on our 2.9% positive test rate, 2nd lowest in U.S.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Watch today’s COVID-19 press briefing with the @NDDOH at 3:30 p.m. CT: https://www.facebook.com/ndhealth/videos/209774023649252/ …

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Gov. Walz and I also agreed, for the health and safety of our citizens, they should avoid all nonessential travel. Stay home, stay healthy, and stay connected. (2/2)

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Just had a great call with our friend and neighbor, Minnesota @GovTimWalz, and we agree: There’s no “us and them,” only “we.” Our states share a river, communities and health care systems, and we’ll continue to work together in the fight against COVID-19. (1/2)

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: We’ll discuss updates regarding COVID-19 in North Dakota during today’s press briefing at 3:30 p.m. CT. Watch live: http://www.facebook.com/ndhealth/videos/2860933707288822/ …

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet:

We're doing well comparatively, but we can always do better and are working every day to improve. pic.twitter.com/HRr3dX1dC2

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet:

name: Gov. Doug Burgum

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet:
The process began over the weekend & is focused on: 

1) Protecting the health of children, families & child care workers. 
2) Providing child care for essential worker households.
3) Sustaining the child care sector as an industry that’s essential to every business in ND. (2/3)

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: A recent viral post claims that the President would enact a mandatory nationwide quarantine. When asked about this in his press conference today, the President said, “We are working with the Governors and I don’t think we’ll ever find that necessary.”

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: During a crisis, misinformation is often our greatest enemy. New information regarding COVID-19 remains dynamic and constantly changing. Given the importance and fluidity of this situation it is vital that we circulate only factual reports and refrain from rumor.

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet:
.@NDDOH confirmed a new case of COVID-19 in Morton County, which is the first confirmed case of community spread of the disease in ND. 

It’s critically important to practice social distancing and stay home when you’re sick, even if it’s minor.

We'll be joined by @GirlScouts CEO Sylvia Acevedo & @PaloAltoNtwks President Amit Singh to discuss ND's model for cyber education. http://www.governor.nd.gov/news/burgum-host-girl-scouts-usa-ceo-palo-alto-networks-president-cybersecurity-education-and …

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: The 40-year-old NEPA process has grown more complex, creating multi-year delays for key infrastructure projects like including highways, bridges, pipelines & flood protection. We thank @POTUS & his administration's proposal to modernize & streamline NEPA. http://www.governor.nd.gov/news/burgum-applauds-proposed-updates-nepa-process-streamline-permitting-infrastructure …

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Grateful to the men and women who put their lives on the line to protect the people of North Dakota each and every day. On #NationalLawEnforcementAppreciationDay, we thank all of the officers who keep us safe, including the dedicated troopers of the @NDHighwayPatrol. pic.twitter.com/vrwE8tswDQ

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Excited to deliver the 2020 State of the State Address later this month at the @UofNorthDakota’s Chester Fritz Auditorium. Hope to see you in @GrandForksCity on January 29! pic.twitter.com/YvkqOZNnfi

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Congratulations to North Dakota’s new Supreme Court Chief Justice Jon Jensen on receiving the gavel from Chief Justice Gerald VandeWalle, who provided exceptional leadership during his 27-year tenure, the longest-serving chief justice in state history. pic.twitter.com/aBrTtstCxF

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Grateful to @SecBernhardt for addressing these concerns raised by ND landowners and to @SenKevinCramer and @SenJohnHoeven for bringing the issue to light -- ensuring a fairer, more collaborative process for all involved.  https://www.doi.gov/pressreleases/interior-increases-transparency-refuge-wetland-easements-modernizes-mapping-older … via @interior

name: Gov. Doug Burgum
tweet: Happy New Year! Wishing you a 2020 filled with gratitude and curiosity! pic.twitter.com/64ADVaTY88
